ext_description.p: An Adjacent_stratum_surface_embedded_component_surface_definition is an oriented link in a sequence of stratum and embedded components that result in the completed design. This link is between a and a surface of an embedded component. There may be multiple Adjacent_stratum_surface_embedded_component_surface_definition that reference the same stratum surface in the case where are laterally adjacent. There may be multiple Adjacent_stratum_surface_embedded_component_surface_definition that reference the same stratum surface in the case where embedded components are laterally adjacent. The use of Adjacent_stratum_surface_embedded_component_surface_definition in combination with the position in 2D space of the embedded component within the interconnect is sufficient to uniquely identify the 3D location of the embedded component. The orientation of the Adjacent_stratum_surface_embedded_component_surface_definition is parallel to the Z direction defined by the direction starting with the primary stratum and terminating on the secondary stratum.
ext_description.note: In the case of a design with embedded discrete components the vertical location of a stratum may be dependent on a population consisting of members of Adjacent_stratum_surface_embedded_component_surface_definition and members of .

The embedded component in this Application Object refers to a discrete physical component, not to a feature that is the result of processing during the interconnect fabrication process. That feature is represented in this part of ISO 10303 by the .

specifies the or the that is the start of the direction vector for the Adjacent_stratum_surface_embedded_component_surface_definition.
the words by which the Adjacent_stratum_surface_embedded_component_surface_definition is known.

The precedent_item shall not be the subsequent_item.
If the type of the precedent_item is a then the type of the precedent_item.definition is either or .
If the type of the subsequent_item is a then the type of the precedent_item.definition is either or .
The name shall be unique with a population of Adjacent_stratum_surface_embedded_component_surface_definition.
The combination of the precedent_item and the subsequent_item shall be unique within a population of Adjacent_stratum_surface_embedded_component_surface_definition.

ext_description.p: A Physical_laminate_component is a type of and a type of . The Physical_laminate_component supports the specification of a as a or for the purpose of establishing a datum reference frame for tolerance specification. A Physical_laminate_component shall be in a complex instance with another member of the subtype tree of and . The interpretation shall be in compliance with the interpretation as if Physical_laminate_component were Abstract.
ext_description.note: ISO 10303-11 does not permit Physical_laminate_component to be Abstract. Therefore this requirement is encoded in a rule.

ext_description.p: Physical_laminate_component should be used in complex with some other type.

ext_description.p: A Probe_access_area is a type of . A Probe_access_area may be an . A Probe_access_area is a feature incorporated into the design of an for the purpose of measuring electrical characteristics of the design. It is realized by an area of conducting material that is helping to compose the or upon which the measurement is to be made. The Probe_access_area specifies the which it helps to compose.

example.p: Figure 15 illustrates a detail of a layout drawing that shows a probe area in the layout. Sufficient detail may be included in the design to evaluate accurately probe placement and volume restrictions.

ext_description.example: A Probe_access_area may be a small metalization area placed inside a larger metalization feature such as a that may not be physically visible except for associated soldermask clearance.
ext_description.note: The geometry of the Probe_access_area is provided by the or by the .

A Probe_access_area generated directly from CAD data may not reference the final plating finish since some CAD systems do not have built-in models of the final finish. In this case, the error in the height approximation would have to be taken into account in the receiving system or eliminated by another application that added the final finish data.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: An Internal_stratum_access is a relationship between an and a that provides access to a on an internal . This Application Object is part of a logical structure to identify the special usage of a Via in support of accessing internal conductors in the design.

The combination of the connected_probe and the inter_stratum_feature shall be unique within a population of Internal_stratum_accesses.

ext_description.p: A Generic_physical_network is either a or is an . A Generic_physical_network is the result of mapping a physical connectivity requirement onto the conducting of an . The vertices, specified by , are mapped onto on the surface of one or more conducting in the . The vertices are a subset of the join terminals of the interface components in this . It is the decision of pre-processors whether to consider a associated with a to be in parallel with the current flow in an electrical scenario. That decision shall be represented by including the and the both in the external interface of the interconnect by means of the application of the to each individually. In the case that a pre-processor decides to ignore the current flow through the , the shall not be referenced by a member of .
ext_description.note: The use of the term network in this Application Object refers to the disjoint locations of the features that implement the connectivity. The underlying model assumes that in some domain and context there is a property that is essentially invariant among all the vertices. The default domain and context for this part of ISO 10303 is electrical potential under zero current conditions and at zero Frequency.

The scope of the Generic_physical_network is entirely within the interconnect design view and provides no information about assembly connectivity of design views within which occurrences of the , as may appear.

The application object is provided so that traceability of the required connectivity for an assembly design view to that implemented internally in an may be supported. The application object is provided to specify explicitly the external terminals of the interconnect substrate that are to be connected. In a case where a design organization re-uses an interconnect design, the , since it is the actual connection statement for an , defines the capabilities of the interconnect substrate to satisfy the requirements imposed by the object. There may be many sets of
(one set per assembly design) that reference an interconnect substrate. There is only one set of for an interconnect substrate.

specifies one or more that are definitions for prior versions of the design. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

If the prior_associated_definition exists, then each member of prior_associated_definition shall not be the current_associated_definition.

ext_description.p: If the connectivity_requirement_element is a , then it shall be associated only with a or with a or with a .
ext_description.note: The critical aspect is that the itself is in the role of an external interface for the interconnect and that there are conductive elements connected to it on the same that implement the connectivity requirements of the . The fact that the land is also dependent on a Via or a is secondary to this rule. The Via implements the connectivity requirement and would be related to a referenced by the interconnect_module_network_topology_element attribute. The would be in parallel with the and would therefore also be included in the external interface for the purposes of the . It is the decision of pre-processors whether to consider a associated with a to be in parallel with the current flow in an electrical scenario.

The critical aspect is that the itself is in the role of an external interface for the interconnect, and there are no other conductive elements on the same directly connected to the for the purpose of implementing the connectivity of the .
The connectivity required by the is supported as follows: The associated Via implements a ; The associated implements an external interface in parallel with the .

ext_description.p: Each that participates in the shall be classified identically in at least one of the electrical, thermal, optical conductivity property classification.
ext_description.example: Each for nominal circuitry using copper shall be classified as electrically conductive

ext_description.p: If an electrical, thermal, or optical conductivity property classification classifies a member of that participates in the , then all other members of that participate in the shall also be classified by a classification of the same type.
ext_description.example: An electrical conductivity property classification of 'conductive' for the referenced by a that helps implements a . All other Conductors that implement that shall reference that has an electrical conductivity property classification. In accordance with other rules, it would be expected that all Conductors would reference that was classified as 'conductive'.

The name shall be unique within a population of Generic_physical_networks in the context of the current_associated_definition.
All referenced by a Generic_physical_network in the role of connectivity_requirement_element shall be in the current_associated_definition.

The Generic_physical_network shall not implement direct connections to specified by , or , but shall implement connections only to Component_terminals in the scope of the design view being implemented.

The design features that are implementing the Routed_physical_network are accessed by traversing the structure specified by the attribute.

ext_description.p: A Stratum_feature is a type of . A Stratum_feature may be either a or a , or additionally may be a . A Stratum_feature is a shape realized in the material of the .
ext_description.note: The shape of the Stratum_feature is the result of evaluating the individual contributions including addition and subtraction of individual that contribute to the Stratum_feature, as well as that modify the Stratum_feature.

example.p: Figure 17 illustrates several types of Stratum_feature. The Conductors shown are purposely distorted in aspect ratio because Conductors are enclosed shapes.

ext_description.p: specifies whether or not the Stratum_feature interfaces with a feature of another product in an assembly context. A value of TRUE indicates that the Stratum_feature interfaces with a feature of another product. A value of FALSE indicates that the Stratum_feature does not interface with a feature of another product.
ext_description.note: Certain tolerance information depends on knowledge of a particular feature interfacing with features of a mating product.

A Fiducial_stratum_feature is a type of that is a basis of measurement with respect to other Stratum_features. A Fiducial_stratum_feature is used for accurate alignment of one item with another. Another type of may play the role of Fiducial_stratum_feature in a design.

ext_description.p: A Conductor is a type of realized in a that participates in the implementation of a . A Conductor is a structured that provides sufficient detail to support electrical, mechanical, manufacturing design and analysis in addition to providing a link to geometric property data.

example.p: Figure 4 illustrates a detail of a layout drawing that shows the Conductor in relationship to a component at the next level of the assembly.
The structure in a Conductor may be transferred to a specialized delay calculation processor to calculate path delays in a clock tree.

A Counterbore_passage_template is a type of . A Counterbore_passage_template is a combination of two round coaxial passages. The first passage is either a through-hole or a blind hole, and the orientation of the second passage (the counterbore) is the same as that of the first passage. The first passage is smaller than the second passage, which has a blind bottom condition that mates with the top of the first passage.
the words by which the Counterbore_passage_template is known. It shall be equal to 'counterbore passage template'.
specifies the for the Counterbore_passage_template. The larger_passage specifies the data that is associated with the larger opening of the Counterbore.
specifies the for the Counterbore_passage_template. The smaller_passage specifies the data that is associated with the smaller opening of the Counterbore.

A Countersunk_passage_template is a type of . A Countersunk_passage_template is a combination of two round coaxial passages, one cylindrical and one tapered. The initial diameter of the tapered passage will be larger than the diameter of the cylindrical passage, and will linearly taper to be the same diameter as the cylindrical passage where the two passages meet.
the words by which the Countersunk_passage_template is known. It shall be equal to 'countersunk passage template'.
specifies the for the Countersunk_passage_template. The tapered_passage specifies the data that is associated with the tapered area of the Countersunk passage.
specifies the for the Countersunk_passage_template. The constant_diameter_passage specifies the data that is associated with the constant diameter opening of the Countersunk passage.

An Inter_stratum_feature_template is a definitional construct that defines the cross-section shape of layered constructs.
the words by which the Inter_stratum_feature_template is known.
specifies the role of the for the Inter_stratum_feature_template. The of_passage_technology specifies the material and layered properties for the Inter_stratum_feature_template.

ext_description.note: The Unsupported_passage_template associates shape information with the parametric property information. "Unsupported" carries the meaning that the passage is not mechanically or electrically supported by deposited sidewalls.

ext_description.note: A Via_template provides a template for a plated passage that supports the realization of connectivity. The access_mechanisms attribute relates the Via_template to two or more terminals, thereby capturing complete connectivity information.

ext_description.p: A Layer_connection_point is a type of . A Layer_connection_point is either a or an that resides on the surface of a in the and is defined in the coordinate system of the . The Layer_connection_point Application Object is an intersection concept between the topology requirements, placement requiremets defined in a geometric coordinate system and the material definition.
ext_description.note: A Layer_connection_point may be placed in an area where the conductive material is removed since there is no information contained in this Application Object regarding vertical material processes. It is the abstraction in this standard to separate lateral material description from the vertical material modification processes.

A Layer_connection_point should not be referenced by an extending on one side of the resident_design_layer_stratum and an embedded_component_path extending on the other side. Use the Same join relationship for the entire vertical extent.
Both two dimensional and three dimensional locations are provided to support the case where both a two dimensional and a three dimensional representation of the interconnect design exist.

ext_description.p: An Adjacent_stratum_surface_definition is an oriented link in a vertical sequence of stratum that result in the completed design. There may be multiple Adjacent_stratum_surface_definition that reference the same stratum surface in the case where are laterally adjacent. The use of Adjacent_stratum_surface_definition in combination with the position in 2D space of the within the interconnect is sufficient to uniquely identify the 3D location of the . The orientation of the Adjacent_stratum_surface_definition is parallel to the Z direction defined by the direction starting with the primary stratum and terminating on the secondary stratum.

ext_description.p: A Stratum is a type of and . A Stratum may be a or a . A Stratum consists of a single material within an interconnect substrate. The vertical contours of either boundary surface may vary. Thus, the thickness of the stratum may vary throughout its range. The material used may be specific, such as 24K gold, or more general, such as etched copper. There may only be one boundary.

In most cases, the detail in this figure is generated at the fabricator's facility from more generic engineering data. This part of ISO 10303 is capable of supporting exchange of generic material stackup data or very explicit material stackup data. This part of ISO 10303 considers either stackup data set as design data.

ext_description.p: A Design_layer_stratum is a type of incorporated into an for the purpose of realizing a physical network in one material.

note.p: Design_layer_stratum are usually described as a signal layer or a power or ground plane.

ext_description.p: specifies whether or not the Design_layer_stratum is the primary stratum of the product. The value of TRUE indicates that the Design_layer_stratum is the primary_design_layer_stratum, meaning that it is the stratum occupying the side of the product that has been arbitrarily chosen to be the zero location for the vertical (z) dimension. The value of FALSE indicates that the Design_layer_stratum is not the primary_design_layer_stratum. This orientation information complies with the orientation defined in IEC 61182-1.
ext_description.note: Usual industry practice is to specify the primary stratum as that which has more through hole technology components or more active components on it, but this part of ISO 10303 does not enforce that or any other practice.

It is the role of the transmitting system to designate one layer as primary. This part of ISO 10303 provides sufficient support to unambiguously communicate that and for a receiving system to validate that the primary layer is an outer design layer.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The value of TRUE for the primary_design_layer_stratum shall be specified if and only if the Design_layer_stratum is assigned to the . The Design_layer_stratum shall be assigned to the if and only if the primary_design_layer_stratum is TRUE.

ext_description.note: This constraint is formally defined in the Interconnect_module AO.

The Design_layer_stratum.library_definition must be a Design_layer_stratum.

ext_description.p: A Documentation_layer_stratum is a type of used to describe patterns and other artwork information needed to manufacture a from materials which are not independently implementing a in the printed circuit board.
ext_description.example: A Documentation_layer_stratum generally refers to those layers in domain terms for which there is a specifically designed shape other than, or in addition to, that of the printed circuit board edge, and for which the CAD systems traditionally output a separate master artwork pattern or file, but for which the resulting pattern is not for an independent conductive layer. For a "six layer pcb", in domain terms, there are six independently conductive design layers. This part of ISO 10303 allows the "outer layers" to be described by several to accommodate the different metallurgies that are found on electroless copper plated, electrolytic copper plated, and solder plated or solder coated on the primary and secondary sides of the . The usual design view of the shape of these "outer layers" is that the shapes are identical for all practical purposes and the required shape is the cumulative shape that will appear after all the manufacturing processes are completed. A of conductive material, such as solder paste, is not an independently conductive layer in this context, since its shape is usually dependent upon the independently conductive layer over which it is applied through openings in solder mask or another Documentation_layer_stratum.
ext_description.note: The general case of dielectric layers such as the adhesive , or the consisting of the dielectric substrate between two copper foil in a printed circuit board, is that they are neither a Documentation_layer_stratum nor a . Their shapes are totally dependent upon the overall shape of the printed circuit board and its various passages.
ext_description.example: If the stratum purpose is that of a coverlay, the insulating sheet on the outer surface of a flexible printed harness and the die-cut passages in the dielectric material of the coverlay are defined as Inter_stratum_features. A is used to describe the presence of the material. This in this context is neither a nor a Documentation_layer_stratum.

A Documentation_layer_stratum differs from a in that its Material_identifications include such materials as solder maskant, epoxy ink, or dielectric materials; or materials such as solder paste that are described as conductive by the of the but whose shape is dependent upon that of an independently described .

An example of the shape of an independently described of conductive materials is that of the copper to be found in the traces and lands on the printed circuit board. The shape of a of solder paste is often dependent upon the shape of the of solder mask that in turn is dependent upon the shape of the circuitry on the primary and secondary sides of the over which the solder mask and solder paste are applied.

ext_description.p: A Passage_technology is a description that includes the material stackup parametric data related to the design of the interconnect substrate associated with the the Passage_technology is related to through the as_finished_inter_stratum_extent attribute. A Passage_technology may be either a , a , or a . A Passage_technology specifies material properties and parametric data associated with a specific manufacturing process for identified material, where that material and manufacturing process has been selected for a specific design. None of the referenced by as_finished_inter_stratum_extent is required to be the same material as the deposition_material.
ext_description.note: There is no requirement that Passage_technology application increase the extent of the stackup that existed prior to application of the Passage_technology.

ext_description.note: There is no requirement that the deposition process extend the reach of the on both ends of the passage. There is no requirement that the deposition process extend the reach of the at all.
ext_description.example: A blind via may be deposited from the top, resulting in only two in the as_finished_inter_stratum_extent, only one of which is conductive.

A via may be deposited from the top, with subsequent finishing operation removing all material except the wall resulting in only one in the as_finished_inter_stratum_extent, none of which is conductive.

ext_description.p: An Embedded_component_terminal is a type of included in the design to mate directly with a terminal of a fabricated feature by use of a internally in a layout. An Embedded_component_terminal is a model specifically included to bridge between the discrete purchased items used in a design and the custom fabricated interconnect patterns in a substrate design. An Embedded_component_terminal is an instance of a usage definition for access to a discrete component in the context of a substrate design. An Embedded_component_terminal is included to support using to define the implementation connections to the associated component.
ext_description.note: The modeling approach used here does not imply that Embedded_component_terminal is created as part of the wet or dry chemistr process used to create the patterns on the substrate. It is merely identifying a functional role of a terminal of a discrete part when it is embedded in a substrate. By implication, it is also identifying the role of the associated component, i.e. that the associated component is embedded in the substrate. The method or process of achieving this is not defined in this standard. The Embedded_component_terminal will not be included in a and is treated herein similarly to the terminals. A is required to connect the terminal to the adjacent to satisfy functional connectivity requirements.

ext_description.p: A Primary_stratum_indicator_symbol is a type of that is used to identify the arbitrarily named primary side of a printed circuit board.
ext_description.note: This symbol may be found in the stratum material of the conductive stratum that is on the primary side of the printed circuit board, implemented in a stratum of silk-screen printed marking ink on the primary side, or otherwise. The primary side is normally defined as that side of the printed circuit board which will contain the largest number of components, but in cases where the component count is balanced, the primary side is arbitrarily named for convenience. Not all printed circuit boards contain this symbol.

ext_description.p: A Component_termination_passage is a type of through which a may pass. The properties of the Component_termination_passage are selected to support the .
ext_description.note: The model in this part of ISO 10303 is that the wall of the passage is directly supporting current flow.
Support for the member of that passes through an but is not assembled to the wall of that is provided by the concept.

ext_description.p: A Conductive_interconnect_element_with_pre_defined_transitions is a type of . A Conductive_interconnect_element_with_pre_defined_transitions may be a . The data provided by Conductive_interconnect_element_with_pre_defined_transitions is typical data available from two dimensional CAD applications. The data does not include explicit representation of the variability in the vertical dimension that occurs in a real "planar" product due to material build up of successive layers of material. The derived_from is required to be orthogonal to the centreline_shape, but this is insufficient information in a three-dimensional layout. In a two-dimensional layout, the derived_from shape x direction vector is constrained to be parallel with the x direction vector of the shape of the referenced by the inherited attribute composed_conductor. In a two-dimensional design, all Stratum_features are parallel. In a three-dimensional design, the same parallelism constraint applies, but the underlying substrate is not presumed to be planar. The underlying surface shape idealization is contained in the or . The or shall be populated to specify to a processor the design intent. The centreline_shape shall be a subset of either the points in the or of the points in the .
ext_description.note: The "pre-defined transition" refers to the extrusion of the shape (a cross-sectional definition) along the path defined by its centreline_shape (a ).

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the words by which the Conductive_interconnect_element_with_pre_defined_transitions is known. It shall be equal to 'conductive interconnect element with pre defined transitions'.

The centreline_shape shall be interpreted to be a curve defined within the geometric context of the shape of the design.
ext_description.note: There is no or associated with the Conductive_interconnect_element_with_pre_defined_transitions because the shape is defined in place in the design. There is no or associated with the associated with the Conductive_interconnect_element_with_pre_defined_transitions for the same reason.

When combined with the centreline shape, a complete CAD abstraction is formed for the two-dimensional case. The three-dimensional case requires additional data representing the abstract surface in which the conductor being defined will be located.

A Fiducial is a type of that is a basis of measurement with respect to other Assembly_components. A Fiducial is used for accurate alignment of one item with another. Another type of may play the role of Fiducial in a design.

A Footprint_occurrence is a type of . A Footprint_occurrence references a as a derived_from. A Footprint_occurrence is not a , nor is it a , nor is it a . A Footprint_occurrence is specifically provided to eliminate redundant location information for Lands on different layers and at different x,y locations and other layered concepts that are typically grouped to support the placement of a component.
ext_description.note: This Application Object is provided for high density array footprint occurrences.

This Application Object should not be used to relate Padstack_occurrences. The structure is provided in to relate a to a in a geometric context. Further relationships in the design view will be redundant.
A should be used to related a to this Application Object since that relationship contains sufficient information to query the unambiguously for the definition detailed information.

ext_description.p: A Footprint_occurrence_sub_assembly_relationship is a type of . A Footprint_occurrence_sub_assembly_relationship is an association that specifies a subassembly constraint among two or more that is aggregated into an . A Footprint_occurrence_sub_assembly_relationship does not directly reference the Application Object that is the definition for the . Instead, it uses an indexing mechanism provided by terminal_location and sub_assembly_reference_designation to locate the padstack in the and the land template location in that . The Footprint_occurrence_sub_assembly_relationship relies on the fact that there is no more than one shape for the and that that shape is referenced by the path through the .

ext_description.p: An Inter_stratum_feature is a type of . An Inter_stratum_feature is one of a , a , a , an , an , a , or an . An Inter_stratum_feature spans one or more .
ext_description.note: An Inter_stratum_feature may be realized by removal of material by drilling, routing, punching, chemically etching, laser burning, or otherwise penetrating one or more sequential ; by the addition of material; or by combining both removal and addition of material in the fabrication process.
Keep out or keep in regions can be specified by populating and its optional set of . The can select an as the design feature of interest.

ext_description.p: An Interface_access_material_removal_laminate_component is a type of that indicates that material is to be removed in the realization of access to the .
ext_description.example: If a passage in a silkscreen layer is necessary to gain access to a and it is desire to record the reason for the passage, this Application Object provides that capability.

ext_description.p: An Interface_access_stratum_feature_template_component is a type of provided to provide access to a where auxiliary processes would prohibit direct access to the terminal and where it is necessary to record the explicit relationship.
ext_description.note: A solderpaste may cover the terminal and in some cases it is necessary to denote the fact that the terminal is below the solderpaste. If it is not necessary to explicitly identify the fact that the solderpaste covers the terminal, this Application Object would not be populated. Those cases would occur where geometry queries are sufficient. The Interface_access_stratum_feature_template_component is not on the same as the terminal being accessed.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the Interface_access_stratum_feature_template_component.

ext_description.p: A Join_two_physical_connectivity_definition_supporting_printed_component is a type of . The Join_two_physical_connectivity_definition_supporting_printed_component is included specifically for cases in which analog and digital grounds are kept topologically and physically separate completely through the design process to minimize noise but need to be physically connected for reference voltage purposes.
ext_description.note: This connections is usually required to be at one and only one location.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the words by which the Join_two_physical_connectivity_definition_supporting_printed_component is known. It shall be equal to 'join 2 physical connectivity definition supporting'.

ext_description.p: A Laminate_component is a type of . A Laminate_component may be one of a , an , a , a , a , a , a or a , or additionally may be a . All types of Laminate_component are realized as part of the manufacturing process that produces the interconnect. The scope of the Laminate_component is the interconnect definition. Not all components that are realized by the manufacturing process that produces the interconnect are Laminate_component.
ext_description.example: A Laminate_component is not a even though both may be realized by the same manufacturing process that produces the interconnect.
ext_description.note: A Laminate_component does not appear in an assembly definition.
A Laminate_component is only one of several Application Objects that may be referenced by a or by subtypes of .

A Laminate_component is not an embedded component because an embedded component is a discrete component with separately described physical properties that is processed by the manufacturing process that produces the interconnect.

An embedded component is not an explicit Application Object but is a implicit role of a discrete component established by the inclusion in an interconnect design view of a discrete component by a member of .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the Laminate_component. The cad_layer need not be specified for a Laminate_component.

an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Laminate_component is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Laminate_component as its . There shall be zero or one for each Laminate_component.

ext_description.p: Laminate_component shall be put into an assembly either with use of inherited from , or with use of padstack_occurrence_assembly, or with use of footprint_occurrence_assembly, but not with any combination of them.

if Laminate_component participates in a , then the inherited from shall be the that relates it to the .

ext_description.p:
A Laminate_component_feature is a type of whose scope is that of an interconnect definition. A Laminate_component_feature may be a , or a , or a , or a .
A Laminate_component_feature is a feature of the fabricated interconnect that is either internal or external. A Laminate_component_feature may reference either an item fabricated directly in the interconnect fabrication or a discrete component that is included in the interconnect fabrication process. The scope is the determinant in whether a feature is a Laminate_component_feature or a .
ext_description.note: The scope of a is a discrete assembly.
ext_description.example: A Laminate_component_feature may reference an embedded component as an associated component to indicate that the internal interconnect structure implements a connection to the embedded component. The reference to the embedded component does not imply that that embedded component is fabricated as part of the interconnect.

A Laminate_component_feature may reference a printed component as an associated component to indicate that the internal interconnect structure implements a connection to the printed component. The connection to the printed component is considered separately because the functionality of the printed component is considered separately.
A Laminate_component_feature may reference a as an associated component to indicate that the internal interconnect structure implements a connection to the .

ext_description.p: A Laminate_component_interface_terminal is a type of . A Laminate_component_interface_terminal may be a , a , a , or a . A Laminate_component_interface_terminal is a terminal that is externally visible but that is fabricated as part of the interconnect fabrication. A Laminate_component_interface_terminal may reference either an item that is a or that is a .
ext_description.example: A Laminate_component_interface_terminal may reference a printed connector component as an associated component to indicate that the internal interconnect structure implements a connection to the printed connector component. The connection to the printed connector component is considered separately because the functionality of the printed connector component is considered separately.
A Laminate_component_interface_terminal may reference a as an associated component to indicate that the internal interconnect structure implements a connection to the .

ext_description.p:
A Laminate_component_join_terminal is a type of and a type of . A Laminate_component_join_terminal may be a , a , a , an , or a .
A Laminate_component_join_terminal is a terminal that is internal to the fabricated interconnect. A Laminate_component_join_terminal may reference either an item fabricated directly in the interconnect fabrication or a discrete item that is included in the interconnect fabrication process as a dissimilar material.
ext_description.example: A Laminate_component_join_terminal may reference an embedded component as an associated component to indicate that the internal interconnect structure implements a connection to the embedded component.

A Laminate_component_join_terminal may reference a printed component as an associated component to indicate that the internal interconnect structure implements a connection to the printed component. The connection to the printed component is considered separately because the functionality of the printed component is considered separately.
A Laminate_component_join_terminal may reference a as an associated component to indicate that the internal interconnect structure implements a connection to the .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Laminate_component_join_terminal is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Laminate_component_join_terminal as its . There shall be zero or one for a Laminate_component_join_terminal.

ext_description.p: A Laminate_text_component is a type of that is designed to be interpreted as a single character portion of a text message by a human or by an artificial vision system. A Laminate_text_component may be used to help compose a to form a complete message. The composition will be defined by an instance of that relates all necessary members of to compose the message embodied in the instance of . Each referenced by the stratum_feature_implementation shall be on the same .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the words by which the Laminate_text_component is known.

ext_description.p: specifies the role of the for the Laminate_text_component. There shall be one or more for a Laminate_text_component.
ext_description.note: Multiple may exist in the case that the shape of the character is disjoint, but they are all on the same .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the that contains the font definition and associated parameters to be used for the Laminate_text_component.
specifies the message content, a character, for the Laminate_text_component.

ext_description.p: A Laminate_text_string_component is a type of and is a type of . A Laminate_text_string_component conveys a complete one line message to the viewer. A Laminate_text_string_component is composed by associating one or more individual instances of to the Laminate_text_string_component using one instance of . The Laminate_text_string_component itself does not directly refer to a font definition. The inherited from the supertype is unnecessary since this Application Object is defined by the composition of contributing to it. The position of the Laminate_text_string_component shall be interpreted as a constraint on the position of the individual components contributing to it. The position of the Laminate_text_string_component shall be interpreted as the insertion point for the message. The Laminate_text_string_component may have an orientation with respect to the design coordinate system, in which case the components composing the Laminate_text_string_component shall have a corresponding orientation. The or which locates the Laminate_text_string_component shall be interpreted as a local coordinate system in order that any orientation shall be applied consistently to all components. An implementation shall ensure that adjacent characters that use different fonts still meet the requirement that instances are disjoint.
ext_description.note: If multi-line messages are required, multiple instances of Laminate_text_string_component will be needed, one for each line of the message.

example.p: Figure 13 illustrates possible arrangements and orientation of the Laminate_text_string_component in the material of the . The figure includes multiple members presenting characters.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the words by which the Laminate_text_string_component is known.

specifies the for the Laminate_text_string_component. The specifies either "top", "bottom", or "centre" for the beginning point of the message with respect to the position of the or that is the insertion point for the text. The "top" indicates that the top edge of the bounding box of the first character of the message is aligned with the 'X' axis of the . The "bottom" indicates that the bottom edge of the bounding box of the last character of the message is aligned with the 'X' axis of the . The "centre" indicates that the top edge of the bounding box of the first character of the message and the bottom edge of the bounding box of the last character of the message are equally displaced on either side of the 'X' axis of the .

specifies the for the Laminate_text_string_component. The specifies either "left", "right", or "centre" for the beginning point of the message with respect to the position of the or that is the insertion point for the text. The "left" indicates that the left edge of the bounding box of the first character of the message is aligned with the 'Y' axis of the . The "right" indicates that the right edge of the bounding box of the last character of the message is aligned with the 'Y' axis of the . The "centre" indicates that the left edge of the bounding box of the first character of the message and the right edge of the bounding box of the last character of the message are equally displaced on either side of the 'Y' axis of the .
specifies a role of the for the Laminate_text_string_component.
The inherited from shall only refer as .

A Material_removal_laminate_component is a type of that indicates that material is to be removed in the realization of the feature that is in the role of design_intent. A Material_removal_laminate_component may be a . The requirement shall be interpreted mathematically as a requirement for application of the regularized Boolean subtraction operation. A Material_removal_laminate_component may participate in a relationship with a in the case of complex layout arrangements to resolve the order of the Boolean operations.

ext_description.p: A Multi_layer_material_removal_laminate_component is a type of that indicates that material is to be removed in multiple layers based on the same explicit geometry. The geometric transformations between the are used to position the geometry on the dependent .
ext_description.note: This Application Object is not intended to be used in place of .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the Multi_layer_material_removal_laminate_component. Each referenced by receives the same material shape to within process tolerances.

ext_description.p: A Multi_layer_stratum_feature is a type of . A Multi_layer_stratum_feature causes shapes to be realized in the material of multiple sequential which are all bases on the geometry for the feature. Each shape is effectively a in that , but due to the identical nature of the geometry, there is no need to separately model the geometry. Each shape in the sequential is isolated from other shapes in that .
ext_description.example: Gold plating on Conductors that is based directly on the underlying Copper shape is an example of this Application Object.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the Multi_layer_stratum_feature.

ext_description.p: A Multi_layer_stratum_feature_template_component is a type of . A Multi_layer_stratum_feature_template_component is included to allow the creation of shapes on sequential where those shapes are identical to the shape that references the Multi_layer_stratum_feature_template_component.
ext_description.example: The domain feature known as "edge finger connector" consists of multiple of Copper, Nickel, Gold and each material shape is based on the shape of the underlying in the Copper .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the Multi_layer_stratum_feature_template_component.

A Padstack_occurrence is a type of . A Padstack_occurrence organizes the various and Inter_stratum_features so that one placement may suffice for all Application Objects that are derived from the placement of one padstack.

In that case, there is no need to populate a separate between the and the Pcb, since the between the and the Pcb establishes the required association. Also, in that case, there is no need to separately populate the from to because the template may be deduced from the structure. A Via may appear in a .

A synthetic string may be created by a receiving application for human interaction purposes but there is no exchange requirement on that string.

ext_description.example: An application of multiple Padstack_occurrence_sub_assembly_relationship referencing the same related_view is for the case of split power planes where a pad sits between two power planes and there are three signals, one for each of the power planes and one for the pad.

ext_description.p: A Pcb is a type of . A Pcb describes a printed circuit board. A printed circuit board is nearly a synonym for printed wiring board, except that a printed circuit board may include printed components and a printed wiring board is totally interconnected without printed components. This part of ISO 10303 supports the exchange of product categories in order to allow the exchange partners to differentiate between printed wiring board and printed circuit board.

example.p: Figure 14 illustrates a printed wiring board design.

Figures 15 and 16 illustrate complex printed wiring board mechanical designs that have functional shape requirements that are communicated using Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing information in a product model and not graphically.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the Pcb. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: A Plated_inter_stratum_feature is a type of with deposited metal on its walls that makes an electrical connection between conductive patterns on internal , external , or both, of a printed circuit board. A Plated_inter_stratum_feature is one of a , a , a , a , or a , or additionally may be a .
ext_description.note: A cross-section illustration of Plated_inter_stratum_feature that is the result of a wet chemistry process is shown in figure 17. An expanded view of one section of the feature is shown in figure 18.

note.p: Plated_inter_stratum_features that completely pass through the PCB are sometimes known as plated through holes.
Plated_inter_stratum_features are features that may be custom designed for this design by creating custom shapes.

ext_description.p: A Via_terminal is a type of . A Via_terminal is associated with the larger diameter wall of the Via that geometrically approximates a hollow cylinder with some thickness.
ext_description.note: Since the Via itself is not allowed to interface to an item external to the interconnect, there is no concept of a join or interface terminal associated with a Via. The Via_terminal is collocated with and congruent with the entire external wall of the cylinder and may be fastened to as often as necessary.

The correlated_terminals function checks if Conductive_interconnect_element_terminals defined by input1 match Conductive_interconnect_element_terminals defined by input2.
It returns True if the set of defined by input1 contains same items as the set of constructed from precedent_points and subsequent_points of Conductive_interconnect_element_terminal_links specified by input2.
It returns False otherwise.

ext_description.p: A Cutout is a type of . A Cutout may be a , a or a . A Cutout is a closed, internal shape in a substrate. A Cutout may not extend completely through the substrate. Complex Cutouts may be created by using the facilities in .
ext_description.example: Figure 6 illustrates the information required to fabricate the interconnect substrate and also assemble a component onto the interconnect. The Cutout illustrated has a form that is dependent on the component installed in it. Each end of the internal conductor path shown in the figure that mates with a component terminal should be modeled as an . During design of the interconnect substrate, thees features would be considered as interface features whose location is controlled by the mating requirement. In this example the mating requirement is simplified because the component is not a connector.

ext_description.p: A Cutout_edge_segment is a type of that defines an edge segment of a . When the Cutout_edge_segment participates in a that is fully described by a collection of Cutout_edge_segment, the end_vertex of the final segment shall be the start_vertex of the first segment. Adjacent Cutout_edge_segment reference the same member of but in different roles to ensure continuity. A Cutout_edge_segment may be a .

ext_description.p: A Physical_connectivity_interrupting_cutout is a type of that is included in the design of an for the purpose of interrupting one or more connectivity elements in an .
ext_description.note: A Physical_connectivity_interrupting_cutout is used where a relayout of the design that would remove the connectivity elements from the design is not provided, but where traceability to a is required.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the words by which the Physical_connectivity_interrupting_cutout is known. It shall be equal to 'physical connectivity interrupting cutout'.
specifies the that is interrupted with the Physical_connectivity_interrupting_cutout. There shall be one or more for a Physical_connectivity_interrupting_cutout.

A Plated_cutout is a type of and a type of . The Plated_cutout is an interior volume of the substrate, such as a void included for passage of a shaft, and may be plated for EMI shielding purposes. This object conveys the semantic that the interior referenced by the related shape is conductive.
the words by which the Plated_cutout is known. It shall be equal to 'plated cutout'.
A Plated_cutout_edge_segment is a type of and is a type of that helps compose a . The Plated_cutout_edge_segment is a feature with a specified shape that makes up part of the edge of a .
specifies the for whose edge this Plated_cutout_edge_segment is a segment.

ext_description.p: A Dielectric_material_passage is a type of that contains dielectric material. The extent of the Dielectric_material_passage is between the boundary defined by the of this Dielectric_material_passage and the shape of the that is to be filled with dielectric material during manufacture.
ext_description.example: Figure 10 illustrates an exploded, stylized, detail of a Dielectric_material_passage as it appears in two sequential stages of the fabrication process.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the words by which the Dielectric_material_passage is known.
specifies the that defines the outer boundary of the Dielectric_material_passage before it is filled with the specified non-conductive .
specifies either the or the that defines the dielectric material contained in the Dielectric_material_passage. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
The same material shall exist throughout the extent of the passage.

An Interconnect_module_edge is a type of . An Interconnect_module_edge may be a or a . When this information is represented by a planar shape, the interpretation is to be that the planar shape represents a projection of the maximum extent of the Interconnect_module_edge onto the planar shape. The Interconnect_module_edge forms an outer physical boundary of the interconnect substrate.

ext_description.p: An Interconnect_module_edge_segment is a type of . An Interconnect_module_edge_segment may be a . The Interconnect_module_edge_segment is an entity with a uniquely specified shape that makes up part of the edge of an interconnect module.
ext_description.example: Usually each side of a four-sided board is an Interconnect_module_edge_segment, or if a board is a round board, one of the Interconnect_module_edge_segment's may be a notch for orientation purposes. The set of Interconnect_module_edge_segment's together make up the total edge.

ext_description.p: A Plated_interconnect_module_edge_segment is a type of and that forms a section of the edge of an interconnect substrate.
